calendar.p: The Julian calendar, as used in England before 1752. The year starts on March 25.

A Hebrew calendar dating from the creation of the world, based on biblical genealogy. The start date varies according to the biblical texts used. Here, based on the dates given for the same events in other formats, this calendar starts in 3962 BC.
A calendar dating from the Roman discovery of Britain. Based on the dates given for the same events in other formats, this calendar starts in 50 BC.

Labelled drawing of a the frame for a hearse
The wydnesse of the doore at eche ende .4. foote.
The tymber of these .4. vpright Postes to be .5. ynches square and .12. foote longe.
smale tymbre of Three inches square
This poste 10 foote high and .4. ynches square.
This poste
standeth in the
middle to beare
the toppe & goeth
no lower then the .2.d
Raile and is borne by
a crosse beame that goeth
from syde to syde within the hearse.
.1. foote. .2. foote. .6. foote betweene these .2. Railes .3. foote .8. ynches.
.12. foote Longe.
The .2. sydes of the Hearse to be
.12. foote in lengthe and the Tymber
to be .4. ynches square.
The breadthe to be a 3d parte therof
videlicet .9. foote.
This ground sill to be stronger then the rest./
There must be an outrayle Outward Rayle of .22. foote
in lengthe, & .18. in breadthe; Of Tymber aboute foure
ynches square./
The Compasse of a hearse of this syze: .14. yardes
